_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:45:53 using v0.9
title: How has the number of patients not treated 28 days after a cancelled operation changed?
analysis_commentary: The number of patients whose elective operations were cancelled and not treated within 28 days within the same time period also decreases over time and shows the seasonal variation. Normally, after the peak in quarter 4, the percentage begins to decrease again. However, in quarter 1 of 2013/14 the percentage not being treated within 28 days of a cancellation still continues to increase after the 2012/13 quarter 4 peak. Further information will be needed to see if this is sustained.
